Name: cp
Description: The command copies files and directories from a source to a target location.

Arguments.Name: R
Arguments.Description: The `-R` argument copies directories and their entire subtree.

Arguments.Name: H
Arguments.Description: The `-H` argument allows for the following of symbolic links when copying files in specific scenarios.

Arguments.Name: L
Arguments.Description: The `-L` argument allows symbolic links to be followed during file copying.

Arguments.Name: P
Arguments.Description: The `-P` option prevents symbolic links from being followed during the copying process.

Arguments.Name: f
Arguments.Description: The `-f` argument allows for the creation of a new file without prompting for confirmation, overriding any existing permissions.

Arguments.Name: a
Arguments.Description: The `-a` argument preserves the structure and attributes of files but not the directory structure.

Arguments.Name: c
Arguments.Description: The `-c` option copies files using a specific system call, falling back to an alternative method if not supported.

Arguments.Name: i
Arguments.Description: Prompts before overwriting existing files during copying.

Arguments.Name: l
Arguments.Description: Create hard links to regular files in a hierarchy instead of copying.

Arguments.Name: p
Arguments.Description: Preserves various attributes and permissions of the source files during the copy process.

Arguments.Name: S
Arguments.Description: The `-S` argument prevents the preservation of holes in sparse files during copying.

Arguments.Name: s
Arguments.Description: Create symbolic links to regular files in a hierarchy instead of copying them.

Arguments.Name: v
Arguments.Description: The `-v` argument displays files as they are copied.

Arguments.Name: X
Arguments.Description: The `-X` argument excludes the copying of Extended Attributes (EAs) or resource forks.

Arguments.Name: x
Arguments.Description: The `-x` argument prevents traversal of file system mount points.

Arguments.Name: pathname
Arguments.Description: The path argument specifies the location of the source file or directory to be copied and the destination where the copy will be placed.
